get.summary: Create a default challenge DID with no parameters.

post.summary: Create a challenge DID with custom data or options.

200.description: DID representing the newly created challenge.

400.description: Bad request (invalid parameters).

post.summary: Create a response to an existing challenge DID.
post.description: Accepts a challenge DID (the DID of a previously created challenge) and an `options` object, then returns a new DID containing the response. Internally, the Keymaster finds matching credentials and bundles them into verifiable presentations. The response is encrypted for the original challenge's controller and stored as a new asset DID.

challenge.description: DID of the challenge to respond to.

options.description: Additional parameters controlling how the response is created and stored.

registry.description: The registry where the new response DID will be created (e.g., "local", "hyperswarm").

validUntil.description: Expiration time for the response DID. If omitted, defaults to 1 hour from now.

retries.description: How many times to retry resolving the challenge DID if it is not immediately resolvable.

encryptForSender.description: Whether to include an encrypted copy for the sender (the responding party). Defaults to true.

includeHash.description: Whether to embed a hash of the plaintext in the stored asset. Defaults to false.

controller.description: A specific ID or DID to act as the controller of the newly created asset. If not set, the current ID is used.

200.description: A DID containing the response to the challenge.

did.description: The DID of the newly created response asset.

400.description: Invalid input (e.g., challenge not found, or required parameters missing).

post.summary: Verify a response to a challenge.

response.description: DID of the challenge response asset to verify.

retries.description: How many times to retry resolving the response DID if initially not found.

delay.description: How many milliseconds to wait between resolution retries.

atTime.description: If provided, attempts to resolve the response DID as of a specific point in time.

atVersion.description: If provided, attempts to resolve the response DID at a specific version.

confirm.description: If true, only returns the DID if it is fully confirmed on its registry.

verify.description: If true, verifies the signature(s) of the response operation(s) before returning the DID Document.

200.description: The result of the verification process.

challenge.description: The DID of the original challenge.

credentials.description: Each credential pair (vc, vp) the response included.

match.description: true if the response satisfies all challenge requirements, otherwise `false`.

vps.description: Any verifiable presentations that passed verification.

400.description: Verification failed or request was invalid.
